questions.question: What is Java Reflection?
answers: A way to dynamically inspect and modify the behavior of classes, methods, and fields at runtime
A feature to create immutable objects
A process of overriding methods during runtime
A mechanism to synchronize threads dynamically

questions.question: Which package contains the core classes for reflection in Java?
Which method is used to obtain the class object for a given class in Java?
What can you NOT do with Java Reflection?
What is a major drawback of using reflection?
What is the purpose of annotations in Java?
answers: To provide metadata for Java code
To write comments that are accessible at runtime

questions.question: Which of these is a built-in Java annotation?
What is the role of the `@Retention` annotation?
answers: Specifies the lifecycle of the annotation
Defines whether the annotation is repeatable
Marks an annotation for overriding methods

questions.question: Which retention policy ensures that an annotation is available at runtime?
What is a marker annotation in Java?
answers: An annotation that requires a default value
An annotation that is only used for documentation
An annotation that must be inherited

questions.question: Can you create custom annotations in Java?
answers: No, Java only supports built-in annotations
No, custom annotations are not supported

questions.question: What is an enum in Java?
answers: A special class that represents a group of constants
A data type that can hold multiple values at once
A way to create mutable collections of objects
A replacement for arrays in Java

questions.question: How do you declare an enum in Java?
Which method is NOT available for Java enums?
Which of the following is true about Java enums?
answers: Enums can have fields and methods
Enums are always static and final

questions.question: What does the `ordinal()` method of an enum return?
answers: The position of the enum constant in the enum declaration
The name of the enum constant
The hash code of the enum constant
The value of the constant as a string

questions.question: Which keyword is used to explicitly call a superclass method that is overridden in the subclass?
Which method can be overridden to provide a custom string representation of an object?
What is the default return type of a static factory method used to return an instance of a class?
answers: The type of the class being instantiated
Any type, based on the method's return type

questions.question: Which method in the `Class` class can be used to retrieve an array of declared methods of a class, including private ones?
What happens when an annotation has a `RetentionPolicy.CLASS` retention?
answers: The annotation is only visible in source code
The annotation is available in the compiled bytecode but not at runtime
The annotation is visible at runtime
The annotation is ignored entirely by the compiler
